title: Pakistan: Citi Pioneers the Launch of Prepaid Cards
summary: Citi Pakistan has introduced the first-of-its-kind prepaid card in the local market. The prepaid card is a payment solution through which an electronic account is pre-funded by a corporate client to be used by its employees. Individuals receiving payments will be able to use the prepaid card at point-of-sale terminals, or to draw their funds from ATMs across the country. This will in effect replace existing checks, vouchers or cash payments with a more efficient, secure and convenient Prepaid Visa Card.
tag-1: Pakistan: Citi Pioneers the Launch of Prepaid Cards
tag-2: Citi Pakistan has introduced the first-of-its-kind prepaid card in the local market. The prepaid card is a payment solution through which an electronic account is pre-funded by a corporate client to be used by its employees. Individuals receiving payments will be able to use the prepaid card at point-of-sale terminals, or to draw their funds from ATMs across the country. This will in effect replace existing checks, vouchers or cash payments with a more efficient, secure and convenient Prepaid Visa Card.
tag-3: Citi Pakistan's GTS Head Salman Hussain said, "The Prepaid Card is simply a better way to pay an individual and can cater to a variety of payment flows, such as employee compensation. In addition, as we mature with prepaid cards, we will look to further expand it to the public sector, where we can eliminate their operational inefficiencies to make lives easier for the people of Pakistan."
tag-4: "The Citi Prepaid Card is the first of its kind in Pakistan and could revolutionize payment flows across various industries. Citi currently partners with more than 1,400 corporate and government institutions (including more than 40 of the Fortune 100) to provide prepaid payment solutions," said Yousaf Ahmad, Head of Global Banking for Citi Pakistan.
tag-5: "The Prepaid Card is a true demonstration of Citi's unique strength, innovation and most importantly, globality," said Citi Pakistan's Country Officer, Arif Usmani. "We are the largest global provider of corporate and government prepaid card solutions and enjoy a 13-year history in this space. We are optimistic that this new card will provide companies with a more efficient means of processing their payments."
